Class TrainTestEvalTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Table>, Future<Table>, EvalTask<Table>

    public class TrainTestEvalTask
extends AbstractTask<Table>
    The command that run the algorithm instance and output the prediction result file and the evaluation result file

    GroupLens Research

        public TrainTestEvalTask addMultiMetric(File file,
                               List<String> columns,
                               com.google.common.base.Function<Recommender,List<List<Object>>> metric)
        Add a metric that may write multiple columns per algorithm.
        Parameters:
        file - The output file.
        columns - The column headers.
        metric - The metric function. It should return a list of table rows, each of which has entries corresponding to each column.
        Returns:
        The command (for chaining).

      • setIsolate

        public TrainTestEvalTask setIsolate(boolean iso)
        Control whether the train-test evaluator will isolate data sets. If set to true, then each data set will be run in turn, with no inter-data-set parallelism. This can reduce memory usage for some large runs, keeping the data from only a single data set in memory at a time. Otherwise (the default), individual algorithm/data-set runs may be freely intermingled.
        Parameters:
        iso - Whether to isolate data sets.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • getMasterLayout

        public TableLayout getMasterLayout()
        Get the master table layout. This can be used by metrics to prefix their own tables.
        Returns:

      • prefixFunction

        public com.google.common.base.Function<TableWriter,TableWriter> prefixFunction(AlgorithmInstance algorithm,
                                                                      TTDataSet dataSet)
        Function version of prefixTable(TableWriter, org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.algorithm.AlgorithmInstance, TTDataSet). Intended for use with Suppliers.compose(com.google.common.base.Function, Supplier).

      • prefixTable

        public TableWriter prefixTable(TableWriter base,
                      AlgorithmInstance algorithm,
                      TTDataSet dataSet)
        Prefix a table for a particular algorithm and data set.
        Parameters:
        base - The table to prefix.
        algorithm - The algorithm to prefix for.
        dataSet - The data set to prefix for.
        Returns:
        A prefixed table, suitable for outputting the results of evaluating algorithm on dataSet, or null if base is null.
